page.title: 05THE RIVER CHESS
page.content: 100 years ago the river was called the {Chesham Stream,}that is how the{River {Chess}got its name.The Chess used to have several{watercress beds and paper {mills}powered by the river.The river has{pure,unpolluted water}with{eels, {crayfish,goldfish,trout,water voles {and shrews. } Alongside the Chess is The Highland {Water Gardens}where they grow and sell {water plants and ornamental fish}.They have a mail order business selling ponds and fountains as well as plants and fish. They{pump water from the {Chess}for the fish tanks and the plants which are kept in large,shallow troughs of watery soil.They{pay the {Water Authority for the water,}as tap water would be more expensive.They {maintain the river banks}which they own,but the Authority clear the river of weeds every year.
